vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/6600dd35-ac34-41ec-88a6-2a8e2aa830bb">YOUTH</keyword>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Youth - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The 1998 'Young People's Social Attitudes' survey is an off-shoot of the 1998 'British Social Attitudes' survey (held at the UK Data Archive under SN:4131). It was designed to explore the attitudes and values of children and young people and make comparisons with those held by adults in 1998 and with other young people interviewed on the 1994 'Young People's Social Attitudes survey'(held under SN:3629). All young people aged 12-19 living in households of BSA respondents were approached for interview.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br> The file (bsa98yp.por) contains data for 474 respondents aged 12-19 from a 40 minute face-to-face interview, covering social attitudes and demographic characteristics. The data may be linked via serial number to the adult in household for the 1998 'British Social Attitudes' survey.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1998-04-01T00:00:00Z">April 1998</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="1998-09-01T00:00:00Z">September 1998</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Council Areas</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Counties</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Local Authority Districts</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Postcode (Sector)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Wards (Electoral)</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Westminster Parliamentary Constituencies</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Young people</universe>         <universe>Young people aged 12-19 living in private households in Great Britain south of the Caledonian Canal during 1998</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>whilst this is not a regular series, a previous YPSA survey was carried out in 1994 (see SN:3629)</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>National Centre for Social Research</dataCollector>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <sampProc>BSA98 respondents were sampled using a multi-stage stratified random probability sample. All young people aged 12-19 living in the household of BSA98 respondents were approached for interview on the Young People's survey.</sampProc>         <deviat>(A)   624 (target)   474 (obtained);(B)   474 (obtained)</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting variable used: YPWT. See documentation for details.</weight>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. See <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions.aspx>terms and conditions of access</a> for further information.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>3629 Young People's Social Attitudes, 1994 </relStdy>       <relStdy>5250 Young People's Social Attitudes, 2003 </relStdy>       <relPubl>Thomson, K. et al (2000) <i>1998 British Social Attitudes and Young People's Social Attitudes Surveys: technical report</i>, London: National Centre for Social Research.<br> <li>Park, A. (1999) 'Young people and political apathy' in Jowell, R. et al <i>British Social Attitudes: the 16th Report - who shares New Labour values?</i>, Aldershot: Ashgate.<br></relPubl>       <relPubl><li><a href="http://www.esds.ac.uk/government/citations/" title="Publications citing ESDS Government data">Search for Young People's Social Attitudes Survey in ESDS Government publication search</a>.</li><br></relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
